chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The Javadoc plugin is meant to be a simple, easy way to quickly search for api documentation. Simply populate the Javadoc list (Plugins -> Javadoc -> Edit Search Settings, or Plugins -> Plugin Options -> Javadoc) with the roots of your api trees, and you're good to go.

To search the api trees, they must be saved to a local disk. The standard java documentation can be found at http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp (under Additional Resources, look for "Java SE 6 Documentation"), and the jEdit api should have come with your jEdit installation.

There are two ways to search the api trees, and they both use unqualified class names (so don't include the package; it won't work). Plugins -> Javadoc -> Search... will open up a dialog with an input box requesting the name of the class to search for, and Plugins -> Javadoc -> Search word under cursor will automatically search for whatever class name the cursor happens to be over.
This plugin uses the InfoViewer plugin to display the documentation, which can be configured in Plugins -> Plugin Options -> InfoViewer.
